channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Severe pothole around 40 cm across and extremely deep.

item.title: Builders waste fly tipped looks sharp, 13th February
item.description:

item.title: Pothole Maesbury Road Junction with Willesden Lane, 13th February
item.description:
Huge hole in the road turning into Willesden Lane from Mapesbury Road. Unsafe cause my car to completely go into the hole on it both offside wheels itâ€™s absolutely ridiculous. Brent has the worst roads in London.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping continues unresolved, 13th February
item.description:
Further to ref: 8880708, 8849897, 8730739, 8676867, and 8682206, the issue of constant fly tipping, with black rubbish bags and other rubbish being left out in the communal pathway, continues unresolved week after week. This latest instance occurred on the evening of 13 Feb. Attention to this matter to stop it from happening continuously, week after week, is urgently needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near 34 bloomsbury street, 13th February
item.description:
Van blocking cycle path. Not sure how else to report
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Bloomsbury Street, Bloomsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This problem gets worse as mostly delivery vans park on the "grass verge" whenever dropping off parceks etc., 13th February
item.description:
As said above, the problem has got worse and there is no point in just covering up with dirt as this was done a few doors away and problem is still there because mostly delivery vans and even cars park on the "dirt grass verge". Perhaps needs to be covered with cement if at all possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Sherwood Park Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked street drain, 13th February
item.description:
3rd time reporting issue The drain in Crescent Drive , outside 204/206, is again not draining and rain water pooling in road flowing over to opposite drains (outside 229) causing drives to flood ( 227 & 229) . I have reported it x2 already but the report keeps coming back stating nothing wrong- please can the drain outside 206 be flushed through as definitely NOT draining rain water away, even with light rainfall!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crescent Drive, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winchelsea Avenue, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gulley cover, 13th February
item.description:
Hi for over 2 months I get email back saying problem fixed, this afternoon after reporting damaged road and missing cover 2 hrs after reporting I got msg saying its fixed, 2 cones have been placed there but that's it. this is a danger to cyclists if front wheel gets caught in broken drain, pls look at photo again. Road need repairing and gulley cover levelling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northend Road, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fixed? Not fixed., 13th February
item.description:
Outside 100 Harland, This was reported as fixed so went back to check, looks untouched to me plus the flooding in the whole of the area made worse by all the uneven slabs on this stretch, pkease go back and revisit this stretch

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Harland Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
